channel.title: If you plan on using Java for game programming
channel.description:
If you plan on using java for game programming in the future, and by "in the future" I mean when your older and have gotten a degree in java programming, will you join a game company e.g. Jagex, gpotatoe, blizzard, etc.? Or will you try and start your own company?
I know it's kind of a weird question, but I want to know. :P

item.title: If you plan on using Java for game programming
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

I would want to move to the USA and join a gaming firm, eg Valve, Bungie etc. as I know that the gaming industry doesn’t have as large a presence in the UK.

And before you correct me, no, I’m not going to work for Fagex.

Read full topic
item.source: If you plan on using Java for game programming

item.title: If you plan on using Java for game programming
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:19, topic:407293”]I’d start my own… I FEEL IT IS MY DESTINY.

No, but in all honesty I would try to start my own. Or at least be a part of an indie or underground gaming company to ride it’s curtails to fame and fortune. I would not want to apply myself to an already well established company… I’d think the lenience factor would not exist, and room for any construction would be slim due to it being already established. Plus, I love creation, that’s why we’re all here on this forum right?[/quote]Mmm mitb should start a community ran game design and creation company.

Read full topic
item.source: If you plan on using Java for game programming

item.title: If you plan on using Java for game programming
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

I’d start my own… I FEEL IT IS MY DESTINY.

No, but in all honesty I would try to start my own. Or at least be a part of an indie or underground gaming company to ride it’s curtails to fame and fortune. I would not want to apply myself to an already well established company… I’d think the lenience factor would not exist, and room for any construction would be slim due to it being already established. Plus, I love creation, that’s why we’re all here on this forum right?

Read full topic
item.source: If you plan on using Java for game programming

item.title: If you plan on using Java for game programming

item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

If you start a company I’ll be the first employee right grail?

item.title: If you plan on using Java for game programming
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote="(Anthony), post:16, topic:407293"][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=508577.msg3691026#msg3691026 date=1312131056]

[quote author=Evil_ link=topic=508577.msg3691023#msg3691023 date=1312130972]

[quote author=object link=topic=508577.msg3690005#msg3690005 date=1312064377]
I already have worked for a game company. It was fun and all. But my goal is to start my own in a foreseeable future. And I’m almost sure it won’t be about game development. If you do plan starting your own game company, it will take you months or years before you get an actual income. So it’s hard to succeed, even if you have a great idea.
[/quote]Notch.
[/quote]And he even sucked at Java everything!
[/quote][/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: If you plan on using Java for game programming

item.title: If you plan on using Java for game programming
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:10, topic:407293”][quote author=Evil_ link=topic=508577.msg3691023#msg3691023 date=1312130972]

[quote author=object link=topic=508577.msg3690005#msg3690005 date=1312064377]
I already have worked for a game company. It was fun and all. But my goal is to start my own in a foreseeable future. And I’m almost sure it won’t be about game development. If you do plan starting your own game company, it will take you months or years before you get an actual income. So it’s hard to succeed, even if you have a great idea.
[/quote]Notch.
[/quote]And he even sucked at Java everything![/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: If you plan on using Java for game programming

item.title: If you plan on using Java for game programming
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:14, topic:407293”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=508577.msg3691958#msg3691958 date=1312173734]

If you want to get into game programming, learn C++. Fuckin javaboys.

I am learning C++ only because I plan on making some small games or the PSP here soon. Already got the SDK and such setup.

@Topic - If I get a degree in java programming (or a certificate, etc) I would most likely work at a company while working on my own idea’s at home. If thus company made me sign a contract saying that my idea’s were now theirs, I would release everything under a friends name.
[/quote]

Can you get a degree in Java programming? Not saying you can’t, but I’m just curious.[/quote]
Not sure that’s why I said ‘or a certificate’ lol. A certificate sounds more practical, as its covering one item (language), unlike getting a degree in, for example, culinary, covers a very wide range.

Read full topic
item.source: If you plan on using Java for game programming

item.title: If you plan on using Java for game programming
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:13, topic:407293”][quote author=The Enforcer link=topic=508577.msg3691096#msg3691096 date=1312133445]
If you want to get into game programming, learn C++. Fuckin javaboys.
[/quote]
I am learning C++ only because I plan on making some small games or the PSP here soon. Already got the SDK and such setup.

@Topic - If I get a degree in java programming (or a certificate, etc) I would most likely work at a company while working on my own idea’s at home. If thus company made me sign a contract saying that my idea’s were now theirs, I would release everything under a friends name.[/quote]

Can you get a degree in Java programming? Not saying you can’t, but I’m just curious.

Read full topic
item.source: If you plan on using Java for game programming

item.title: If you plan on using Java for game programming
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

The Enforcer:

If you want to get into game programming, learn C++. Fuckin javaboys.

I am learning C++ only because I plan on making some small games or the PSP here soon. Already got the SDK and such setup.

@Topic - If I get a degree in java programming (or a certificate, etc) I would most likely work at a company while working on my own idea’s at home. If thus company made me sign a contract saying that my idea’s were now theirs, I would release everything under a friends name.

Read full topic

I already have worked for a game company. It was fun and all. But my goal is to start my own in a foreseeable future. And I’m almost sure it won’t be about game development. If you do plan starting your own game company, it will take you months or years before you get an actual income. So it’s hard to succeed, even if you have a great idea.
